intro: Mouroucoa elliptica, commonly known as the elliptical mouroucoa, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its elliptical leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in moist forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant in some regions.
